chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)
Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Richard Rivard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin Richard Rivard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin Richard Rivard was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Kevin Richard Rivard was found guilty of Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to report to probation no later than 10/17/22 at 12:00 PM. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

9:59 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Kevin Richard Rivard. Defendant Kevin Richard Rivard in court. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 2 - Possession of THC and Ct 5 - Neglecting a Child. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 - Possession of THC and Ct 5 - Neglecting a Child. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 1, 3 and 4. Sentencing recommendations. 

Court orders: 
Ct 2 - Possession of THC
- 90 days jail - entitled to Good Time and approved for Huber
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

Ct 5 - Neglecting a Child
S/W 3 years probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Complete Parenting Course
- No abusive contact with children in the household
- Comply with any CHIPS or dispositional orders
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

Monthly payment plan approved to continue. 
Defendant to report to jail no later than 12/16/22.
2 days jail credit. 
Defendant to report to probation no later than 12:00 PM today, 10/17/22.

22SW132 executed on 4/5/2022. Search Warrant, Application and Affidavit signed by EFV on 4/5/2022. Filed in 22CF226. olg
Pretrial Assessment Report. hml
Status conference on April 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, D.T.W. dob 05/19/09 & R.L.R. dob 01/29/19.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
